channel.title: XML.com
channel.description: XML.com features a rich mix of information and services for the XML community.

item.title: A Hyperlink Offering
item.description: Prompted by recent debate over XHTML 2.0's invention of HLink, Achilles and the tortoise meet to discuss the use of linking in W3C specifications.

item.title: XMLPULL: A Response
item.description: The creators of the XMLPULL API for Java respond to Elliotte Rusty Harold's recent review of their API on XML.com

item.title: Introducing HLink
item.description: Kendall Clark provides an introduction to HLink, the linking language invented by the XHTML 2.0 Working Group as an alternative to XLink.

item.title: Introducing PyXML
item.description: In the second Python and XML column, Uche Ogbuji introduces PyXML, the add-on XML library which builds upon Python's core XML support.

item.title: Dirty XSLT Output
item.description: John Simpson returns to answer more XML questions; this time he tackles a tricky interaction between implicit and explicit XSLT rules.

item.title: Euro-XML
item.description: The introduction of the Euro currency in Europe has brought about changes in commonly used character sets. Rick Jelliffe discusses the impact on XML applications.

item.title: XML Canonicalization
item.description: Bilal Siddiqui explains the process of canonicalizing XML documents, useful in determining the logical equivalence of documents in order to secure XML exchanges.

item.title: Brother, Can You Spare a DIME?
item.description: In this month's Endpoints column, Rich Salz describes the DIME, a binary message format, and WS-Attachements specifications.

item.title: The State of the Python-XML Art
item.description: In the first installment of our new Python-XML column, Uche Ogbuji offers a bird's-eye tour of the Python-XML world, including books, discussion forums, and software packages.

item.title: What Are XForms?
item.description: HTML forms have long been a weak link in web interfaces -- now XML comes to the rescue with XForms, the W3C's new web forms technology. Update: 9/11/2002

item.title: What Are Topic Maps?
item.description: An introduction to XML Topic Maps, an XML standard that can be used to index and capture relationships between concepts, improving the findability of information.

item.title: Identity Crisis
item.description: Kendall Clark examines section 2 of the W3C Technical Architecture Groups "Architectural Principles of the World Wide Web", concerning Identifiers and Resources.

item.title: Simple Text Wrapping
item.description: In his latest SVG column, Antoine Quint explains how to implement text wrapping in SVG.

item.title: Structural Patterns in XML
item.description: Will Provost shows how design patterns in XML structures can be used to help development of W3C XML Schemas.

item.title: What's Next for HTML?
item.description: Micah Dubinko examines upcoming developments in the HTML family, including XHTML 2.0, XML Events and XFrames.
